column5: I'm building a couple small trailers to tow behind snowmobiles for some friends. I built one last year from some scrap metal at work, but I don't have access to the amount of steel I need for the project and Princess Auto is too expensive.  I need about 100 feet of 1" angle iron. I'm also looking for reasonably priced used snowmobile skis if anyone knows where to find some.

you can try these guys not sure if they sell to the public  http://www.salitsteel.com/contact_main.php#   Ronco 921 Zelco Drive Burlington, Ontario L7L 4Y2 Telephone: (905) 333-3975 Fax: (905) 333-4510   Armour Steel Supply Ltd. 50 Dartnall Road Hamilton, Ontario Canada L8W 3N1 905 388-7751 Fax: 905 388-7757
princess auto sells all kinds of metal stock.

Hey Boatman,  Your asking where to by steel in steel town eh!!   I use Metal Supermarkets every now and then.  There's one in (or very close to) the hammer.   I think it's in Winona.  They have all sorts of steel in stock.
That's right. I know where they make it, but not where they sell it.  I normally buy steel at Princess Auto because its convenient, but its just too expensive to buy this amount of steel there.

How quick do you need it. I buy from all the warehouses but I'm going away next week and can't arrange for anything that fast. Go to a steel fabricator and ask them. 1x1x1/8 should be around a buck a foot
I would try a used shelving dealer they usually have all kinds of angle iron.
Looks like Metal Supermarkets is the place for me. About 2/3 the price of Princess Auto and no problem getting small quantities.  Thanks everyone
Industrial Material Center (905) 662-8141  234 Arvin Stoney Creek  These folks are wonderful. I use them to supply my shop at school and they welcome all customers. Jim
Glanbrook Iron has "used" steel availible at a low cost. If you need my trailer to pick it up swing by and grab it.
